message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CG 

The paper deals with linear network coding, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It also involves the use of vector spaces and their intersections, which are concepts in algebraic geometry and number theory (cs.NT). The construction of equidimensional vector spaces with large distances between them suggests a possible application in coding theory and error correction (cs.DS). The use of forms and the mention of Veronese varieties suggest a connection to computational geometry (cs.CG). Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of signal processing (cs.SI) due to its focus on transmitting and receiving information.
